history.text: Hello!
Do you know the story of how Facebook came about?
Well, there's a movie about it called The Social Network
Have you heard of it?
I have heard of it!
Is it any good?
It stars Jesse Eisenberg as Mark Zuckerberg and tells the story of Facebook's founding and the resulting lawsuits.
I would say it's pretty good as it got a 95% rating on Rotten Tomatoes
Oh that is a great score. Who else is in the movie?

as well as good ratings
on other review sites
The film also stars Andrew Garfield, Justin Timberlake, and Armie Hammer
When did it come out?
It came out in 2010
October 1, 2010 to be exact
The movie is actually based off a book of how Facebook was found
Oh wow, a while ago. Is it appropriate for kids?
Who wrote the book?
The Accidental Billionaires by Ben Mezrich

So the movie starts off with Zuckerberg, who at the time was at Harvard,
 being dumped by his gf
He returns to his dorm to write an insulting post about her on his blog and then creates a website called Facemash by hacking in the college database
ouch. he sounds kinda mean. is he supposed to be the good guy?
Facemash ends up taking off and attracts the attention of the Winklevoss twins and someon named Divya Narendra
They invite Zuckerberg to help them work on a social networking site called the Harvard Connection which is exclusive to Harvard students only
and is aimed at dating
Ooh, the foundations of Facebook?
Yea, somewhat
At first it was called thefacebook and Zuckerberg extended it to Yale
He eventually meets up with Sean Parker (played by Timberlake) who founded  Napster who pitches his ideas for Facebook.
Parker also suggests dropping "the" from thefacebook and the company moves to Palo Alto

Saverin (played by Andrew Garfield) remains in N
Y to work on developing the business
Seems like the split and addition of Parker may cause a rift
Did Sean Parker make it so that it wasn't exclusive to harvard and yale?
Well, Zuckerberg invites him to live at his house which he was using as the company HQ

Well, at that point it was only for Harvard and Yale, but as we all 
know Facebook eventually expanded
Does Andrew Garfield come out to palo alto or stay in NY? Hard to run a business like that!
Andrew Garfield's character eventually ends up suing Zuckerberg
Woah!

and so do
 the Winklevoss twins
Is it over the concept of the website?
maybe intellectual property or something like that
yea, the twins said Zuckerberg stole their idea
while Saverin (Garfield) claims his shares were diluted

uid2response.feedback: Sounds like a pretty good movie. I like the actors, the plot sounds interesting, and this is a cultural phenomenon that I'm not quite sure how it got started. Neat!
